key.name: current-layout-id
key.description: The ID of the currently active window layout layout.

key.name: current-zone-index
key.description: The index of the currently active zone within the current layout (0-based).

key.name: cycle-zone-left
key.description: Move the focused window to the previous zone in the current layout.

key.name: cycle-zone-right
key.description: Move the focused window to the next zone in the current layout.

key.name: maximize-window
key.description: Toggle maximize state of the focused window, or restore a minimized window.

key.name: layout-picker-size
key.description: Size of the layout picker dialog as a fraction of screen size (0.3-0.9). Default is 0.8 (80%).

key.name: layout-order
key.description: Array of layout IDs in custom display order. Empty array means use natural order.

key.name: ui-theme
key.description: Color scheme for extension UI dialogs. Options: 'system' (follows GNOME color-scheme), 'light' (force light mode), 'dark' (force dark mode). Default is 'system'.

key.name: apply-layout-globally
key.description: When enabled (default), applying a layout affects all monitors and workspaces. When disabled, user can choose specific monitor and workspace for layout application.

key.name: use-per-workspace-layouts
key.description: When enabled, each workspace can have its own layout. When disabled, the layout applies globally to all workspaces.

key.name: workspace-layout-map
key.description: JSON object mapping workspace indices to layout IDs. Example: {"0": "layout-halves", "1": "layout-code"}

key.name: debug-layout-rects
key.description: When enabled, shows colored debug borders around all layout elements in the layout switcher dialog to help visualize layout issues. Red=container, Blue=section, Green=row, Yellow=card, Magenta=spacer.

key.name: debug-layout-overlay
key.description: When enabled, shows a debug overlay with calculated dimensions, tier information, and validation results for layout debugging.

key.name: option-force-tier
key.description: Override automatic tier selection for testing. 0=auto (default), 1=tiny, 2=small, 3=medium, 4=large, 5=xlarge. Use Ctrl+T in layout switcher to cycle through tiers.
